Finance and Investment Job at ILLAJ Holdings




        
    

        
        ILLAJ Holdings is a diversified conglomerate whose subsidiaries span across education, manufacturing, and agriculture. The group is committed to developing sustainable and impact-driven businesses that contribute to human capital development, food security, and industrial growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance and Investment

Job Location: Kaduna 
Employment Type: Full-time

 Responsibilities 
     

            
    




	Maintain responsibility for all financial and fiscal management aspects of company operations.
	Articulate the Holdings financial strategies and ensure alignment of the company strategic priorities
	Ensure that the company’s financing requirements are consistently met, and that capital structure is optimized at all points in time
	Continuously review the company’s performance, identify and appraise business risks/ opportunities, and make appropriate recommendations for business growth and development
	Implement “Open Book Management” practices across the entire subsidiary to maximize transparency and increase staff knowledge about the health of the company and financial management more generally
	Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and
	strengthen internal controls
	Oversee and manage the treasury and financial control functions of the business
	Develop, organize and evaluate all the subsidiaries fiscal function and performance.
	Participate in the development of the organization’s overall strategic goals
	Champion the implementation of the Finance function’s strategy ensuring alignment with organization’s corporate strategy and business goals
	Oversee the preparation of the company’s annual budget and monitor its implementation
	Develop credibility for the Finance function by providing timely and accurate analysis of budgets, financial reports and associated trends to assist Executive Management in performing their duties
	Ensure all databases are updated on the ERP from internal and external sources to enhance the company’s competitiveness and business ranking
	Establish an appropriate management information system for collation, monitoring and reporting purposes
	Support all subsidiaries of IllaJ Holdings to understand and effectively manage their overhead costs, asset expenditures and unit economics (if applicable)
	Develop and maximize business relationships with Bankers, Finance & General Purpose/Audit committees of the Board of Directors and regulatory officials
	Ensure the company operates in accordance with all relevant laws, regulations and accounting standards applicable to its operations Stat
	Coordinate the preparation and reporting of the company’s financial position with the accountant
	Coordinate the Regular preparation and reporting of cash flow statement withthe accountant
	Monitor all the operating base costs and highlight factors impacting effective cost management towards achieving a low-cost business environment


 Knowledge, Skills & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, finance, Economics, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree or CFA designation preferred.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in Accounting, investment management, risk management, or related roles, with a proven track record of success in developing and executing investment strategies.
	Professional Certificate in ACCA, ICAN OR ANAN
	Master's degree in any relevant field of study is an added advantage
	Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with experience in financial modeling, valuation analysis, and due diligence processes.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and clients across departments.
	Demonstrated leadership abilities, with experience in managing teams and driving strategic initiatives.


 Salary
N450,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr@illaj.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Trade Marketing & B2B Manager Job at Elkris Foods




        
    

        
        Elkris Foods is an innovative and indigenous food manufacturing and packaging company in Nigeria. We are here to bridge the chasm between our rich, delicious variety of indigenous soups and the poor quality of existing swallows. With this, our Swallows will naturally become a rallying point for our local soups. We also want to present to Nigerians and in fact the entire African continent a plethora of uses our healthy flour can serve. Consequent upon this, we are specifically devoted to the development and production of healthy alternative Swallows, Beverages, Cereals, and Confectionery.
     

            
    



Although Elkris Foods started in the UK, we decided to move our business to Nigeria to rightly and effectively position ourselves to leverage the population forecast of Nigeria becoming the one of the top three most populous nations by the year 2030. The strategic intent is to have any of the Elkris Foods Brands on the breakfast, lunch or dinner of at least 20 million households across Nigeria every year by the year 2030 to promote a healthy diet culture among the populace.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Trade Marketing & B2B Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Elkris Foods is a fast-growing food brand committed to quality, innovation, and strong market presence.
	We are seeking a highly driven Trade Marketing and Business-to-Business (B2B) Manager to join our team and help expand our footprint across key trade channels.
	Female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute trade marketing strategies to drive product visibility and sales growth
	Manage and grow B2B relationships with distributors, wholesalers, retailers, and corporate clients
	Plan and implement in-market activations, promotions, and merchandising activities
	Analyze market trends, customer insights, and competitor activities to inform strategy
	Work closely with sales and operations teams to ensure effective execution of trade programs
	Negotiate commercial terms and manage key trade accounts
	Prepare regular performance reports and recommendations for management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in trade marketing and/or B2B sales (FMCG experience is an advantage)
	Strong negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills
	Proven ability to execute trade marketing campaigns successfully
	Good understanding of Lagos trade channels and distribution networks
	Result-oriented, organized, and able to work independently.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Growth and leadership opportunities
	A dynamic and supportive work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@elkrisfoods.com using “Trade Marketing & B2B Manager – Lagos” as the subject of the email.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / HR Assistant

Job Location: Amuwo Odofin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Core Duties and Responsibilities
Recruitment and Onboarding Support:


	Assist in drafting specific job descriptions for sales roles and other positions in the company.
	Post job advertisements on various platforms and manage the influx of applications.
	Screen CVs, conduct initial interviews, check references, and prepare job offers for successful candidates.
	Coordinate the onboarding process, including preparing new hire paperwork (contracts, handbooks), conducting orientation sessions, and ensuring new sales staff understand company policies and culture.


Employee Relations and Welfare:


	Assist in managing employee relations issues, resolving basic conflicts, and handling grievances or disciplinary procedures in line with company policy and legal requirements.
	Promote employee well-being initiatives and help foster a positive work environment, which is crucial for motivating a sales team.
	Manage leave requests, monitor attendance, and address related queries.


Compensation and Benefits Administration:


	Administer payroll and ensure employees receive accurate and timely compensation, including processing salary, bonuses, and sales commissions in coordination with the finance department.
	Manage employee benefits programs (health insurance, pensions, etc.), including enrollment and answering questions.


Training and Development Coordination:


	Coordinate training and development programs, which might include specific sales techniques, product knowledge (solar/inverter tech), and soft skills workshops.
	Support managers in identifying training needs and implementing performance improvement plans.


HR Administration and Compliance:


	Maintain and update all employee records (both physical and electronic) with meticulous attention to detail.
	Ensure all HR practices comply with local labor laws and regulations to mitigate legal risks.
	Prepare HR documents such as employment contracts, offer letters, and policy updates.


Qualifications


	A degree in Human Resources, Humanities, Social Sciences or related disciplines from a recognized university.
	A professional HR qualification is an added advantage


Experience:


	A minimum of five (3) years as a Human Resources professional in an organisation.
	Hands on experience of developing and implementing HR policies and procedures.
	Experience in developing and managing performance management processes, practices and systems.
	Experience with staff relations and dealing with staff issues including grievances.
	Proven experience in following up on staff training and development plans.


Method of Application 

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV with Covering Letter to the HR via: voxaby2@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
